Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the intercrine alpha (chemokine CxC) family
Sequence Information.Target Organism: No MICs found in DRAMP database
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Structure Description: GRObeta [5-73] forms a dimer in solution that is architectured by a six-stranded antiparallel beta-sheet (residues 25 to 29, 39 to 44, 49 to 52) and a pair of helices (residues 58 to 68) with 2-fold symmetry, while the C terminus of the protein is disordered.(Ref.2)
Sequence Information.Function: Produced by activated monocytes and neutrophils and expressed at sites of inflammation. Hematoregulatory chemokine, which, in vitro, suppresses hematopoietic progenitor cell proliferation. GRO-beta(5-73) shows a highly enhanced hematopoietic activity.
Sequence Information.PTM: The N-terminal processed form GRO-beta(5-73) is produced by proteolytic cleavage after secretion from bone marrow stromal cells.
Sequence Information.Medical use: GRO-beta(5-73) is available under the name Garnocestim as immunomodulator. It is used prior to hematopoietic transplantation for peripheral blood stem cell mobilization and reduction of incidence, duration, and/or severity of chemotherapy induced cytopenias.

Literature.Title: Many chemokines including CCL20/MIP-3alpha display antimicrobial activity.
Literature.Author: Yang D, Chen Q, Hoover DM, Staley P, Tucker KD, Lubkowski J, Oppenheim JJ.

Literature.Title: Nuclear magnetic resonance solution structure of truncated human GRObeta [5-73] and its structural comparison with CXC chemokine family members GROalpha and IL-8.
Literature.Author: Qian YQ, Johanson KO, McDevitt P.
